alert.note: Alert for San Juan (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 26 at 12:54PM MDT until August 26 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Colorado and southeast Utah, including the following counties, in southwest Colorado, San Miguel. In southeast Utah, San Juan. * WHEN...Until 300 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1254 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Slick Rock. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
